critique: This document establishes a board to investigate a dispute between REA Express and its employees. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or social inclusion. It seems to expand executive power by creating a board, but this is within the bounds of the Railway Labor Act. It has a moderate impact on economic regulation by preventing changes to the conditions out of which the disputes arose. It doesn't directly address federalism or national security vs. civil liberties.
